rn: Haaa, mbona kuwa gatatu uzohava ugorana gato. Je mbona twofata kuwa gatanu nimba ukworohereza?

rn: Harico uzoba uriko urakora mu ndwi iza?
en: Are you doing anything next weekend?

rn: Harintambamyi ishitse mu mwanya kubwivyo ntibikunda ko tubonana inyuma ya sasita. Duhane irindi sango?

rn: i muhira hariho akayabu gatoyi. kari n'utuguru tubiri n'utuboko tubiri. kari n'amabara yera n'ayirabura. karakina n'utubeba dutoduto, ariko iyo gahuye n'ibibeba bininibinini, karabibona kagatuna, kakabimira. iyo hari abana batoyi karakina na bo. karabirukana, kakabaharura ku maboko no ku maguru. bano bana hari aho barira ariko bakaguma bakina na ko. iyo data agiye gukama, karamukurikira. aragaha amata, kakayagotomera.

rn: Kuwa kane ni mwiza kuri je.
Mbe uzoba ufise akanya k'umunsi wa kane uza?

en: I'm afraid I can't on the 3rd. What about the 6th?

That's very kind of you, thanks.
Thank you so much! It's lovely / fantastic / wonderful.

rn: Murantunga gato, hari akazu ku buriro ngaha hafi?
en: Excuse me for a bit could you tell me if there's a restaurant near here?

rn: Murantunga gato, hariho akagorane ku nsusuruzi(imashini isusurutsa) mu cumba canje.
en: Sorry to bother you, but I think there's something wrong with the air-conditioning.

rn: Murantunga mupfaso, woba ufise ikaramu yanje aho?
en: Excuse me Madam; do you have my pen on you?

rn: Murantunga, iyi yoba iriyo nzira ija ku biro vya posita?
en: Excuse me, is this the right way for the Post Office?
Excuse me, would you mind keeping an eye on my luggage?
excuse me, do you accept me to buy it on credit?

rn: Murantunga, nibazako mwokwegeza imodoka yanyu inyuma gato
en: Excuse me; i wonder if you could move your car back a little.

rn: Murantunga; mwomenyera Umuyobozi ari mu biro?
en: Excuse me; do you know if the headmaster is in the office?
I'm really sorry, but I've got something else on.

rn: Muri uyu mwanya ntibikunda ko nsinzira neza nsa nuwugira ayame

rn: Mwaramutse! Mwompa inomero yanyu ya terefone?

en: Good evening! Can you show me the way to Buyenzi?

Can you get me Mr. Mark please?

rn: Ndabona ko bitankundira ko tubunana. Ntitwo hana irindi sango?
en: I'm afraid that I'm not going to be able to meet you after all. Can we fix another time?

rn: Ndikondaribwa n'umutwe canke kuribwa n'amenyo / umushishito / Umugongo
en: I've got a slight headache. Or toothache / stomach ache / backache

en: I'm departing to Gateri Guest House

Urantunga kuwa mbere ntivyokunda. Ntivyokunda ko tubonana kuwa gakabiri?
en: I'm sorry, I won't be able to make it on Monday. Could we meet on Tuesday instead?

rn: Uraziko twaritwasezeranye ko tubonana ku musi wa gatanu uza, urantunga kuko harikintu cihutirwa kizoba.
en: You know we were going to meet next Friday? Well, I'm very sorry, but something urgent has come up.

rn: Uzoba uriko ukora iki kuwagatandatu uza? Tuzofungurira hamwe n'abandi. Ubona woza?
en: What are you doing next Saturday? We're having some people over for a meal. Would you like to come?

rn: Vyari vyiza ariko mfise ibindi nzobandiko ndakora kuwa gatandatu.
en: That's very kind of you, but actually I'm doing something else on Saturday.
Maybe you should go home and get some rest.

rn: Vyokunezera tujanye kuraba ireresi uno munsi mw'ijoro?
en: Would you be interested in coming to the cinema with me tonight?
